intro: Odontotrichum liebmannii, commonly known as the mountain mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia, this plant thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. It is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, where it adapts to cold and harsh conditions. The plant's morphology reflects its evolutionary adaptation to high-altitude habitats, with compact growth and frost-resistant structures.
